Questions.QuestionString: The A318, A319, A320 and A321 (A320 family) are:
Answers: Single Aisle, twin-engine subsonic medium range aircraft.
Single Aisle, twin-engine subsonic short range aircraft.
Double Aisle, four-engine subsonic long range aircraft.

Questions.QuestionString: Amber colour is used:
Answers: For failure needing awareness but no need immediate action,
For failure needing awareness and immediate action,
To indicate normal operation of system.

Questions.QuestionString: How many main zone of the aircraft:
Zone number 100 -199 are located:
Station 0 is located:
What you must NOT do:
Answers: lift the aircraft at the forward jacking point only, with the wheels of the main landing gear on the ground
use the safety stay as soon as the lift operation is finished
use the safety stay to lift the aircraft

Questions.QuestionString: What is the correct sequence?
Answers: install the tow lever safety pin then install the tow bar on the tow fitting
install the tow bar on the tow fitting then install the tow lever safety pin

Questions.QuestionString: Where is access panel 540 BB located?
Sub-zone for LH side of Horizontal Stabilizer is identified by:
What is station number?
Answers: The station number is the distance in centimeters of a cross-section from the Forward bulkhead.
The station number is the distance in centimeters of a cross-section from a reference point.
The station number is the distance in inch of a cross-section from a reference point.

Questions.QuestionString: The reference (station 0) for all structural measurements for the X axis is set at:
Answers: 200 in (508 cm) forward of the A/C nose,
100 in (254 cm) forward of the A/C nose,
100 in (254 cm) after of the A/C nose,

Questions.QuestionString: Which numbers are identified for the LH wing zones?
Where is access panel 540 BB located?
In towing configurations the safety pin locks the control lever on the interphone box in:
Access doors and panels are identified by:
Answers: The number of the zone in which the panel is located followed by a two-letter suffix.
The number of the zone in which the panel is located followed by one letter suffix.
a two-letter followed by the number of the zone in which the panel is located suffix.

Questions.QuestionString: The maximum permitted steering-angle on each side of the aircraft centerline is
Communication system(s) to be used during towing is (are)?
Answers: VHF or HF with FLT INT.

Questions.QuestionString: What indication on ECAM do you have to check prior to start towing?
In the AMM tasks, “WARNING” is meant:
Answers: Calls attention to use of materials, processes, methods, procedures or limits which must be followed precisely to avoid injury of death to persons
Calls attention to methods and procedures which be followed to avoid damage to equipment
Calls attention to methods which make the job easier or provide supplementary or explanatory information

Questions.QuestionString: Minimum separation from the nose wheels and the tractor while towing the aircraft is:
The aircraft frame 24 station is 950, it means:
Answers: The frame 24 distance to the reference point is 950 cm
The frame 24 distance to the reference point is 950 inch
The frame 24 distance to the aircraft nose is 950 cm

Questions.QuestionString: Zone 713 location at
Application of flight configuration precaution is required when
Answers: Jacking a MLG for wheels change
Lifting the aircraft at Forward Jacking Point, MLG Wheels on the Ground

Questions.QuestionString: You can weigh the aircraft with
Answers: The aircraft on its wheels only
The aircraft on jacks or the aircraft on its wheels or the aircraft on landing gear jacks

Questions.QuestionString: When the NLG dimension H is more than 300 mm
Answers: Do not tow the aircraft to prevent damage to the centering cams
Do not tow the aircraft to prevent tail to ground contact
Smooth and speed limited towing is possible

Questions.QuestionString: Safety requirements for aircraft refueling and defueling are
Answers: Operate the cell phones or mobile phones inside distances for 6m from aircraft is allowed
Perform the operation test of the beacon or strobe light system
Do not operate the weather radar or HF system

Questions.QuestionString: When you do the refueling and/or defueling in the hangar
Answers: The hangar doors must be closed until you have completed the refuel/defuel procedure
The hangar doors must not be closed until you have completed the refuel/defuel procedure
There is no requirement for hangar door

Questions.QuestionString: The X axis in the:
The Y axis in the:
The Z axis in the:
When you set the BAT 1&2 P/BSW to AUTO position:
Answers: The right hand dome light is on,
The left hand dome light is on,

Questions.QuestionString: When you perform the pedestal panel check list. On the center pedestal, verify that the speed brake handle is in the:
When you perform the overhead panel checklist and a/c power supply. The voltage should be about 25 volts with:
Answers: The BAT 1&2 P/BSWs in ON position,
The BAT 1&2 P/BSWs in AUTO position,
The BAT 1&2 P/BSWs in OFF position.

Questions.QuestionString: Each area is identified by:
Answers: The major zones, the sub-zones, the zones.
The major zones and the zones

Questions.QuestionString: ST9500/FR24 is located:
How does the flight crew manually fly the aircraft?
Answers: by side sticks mounted on the center pedestal
by side sticks mounted on the side consoles

Questions.QuestionString: Where safety instructions can be found?
Zone number 700 -799 are located:
Engine install on the VNA CEO A321 A/C is:
What is Safety precautions must be taken to avoid danger from engine suction and exhaust areas?
Answers: Access to the engine is only allowed through the entry corridor. Entry corridor must be closed for wind direction greater than 90o. There is no safe access corridor when the engine is running above minimum idle.
Access to the engine is allowed entry in front of engine when engine is runing above minimum idle.
Access to the engine is allowed entry behide of engine when engine is runing above minimum idle.

Questions.QuestionString: Where can you check Attitude (ATT) of the A/C?
The GENERAL TAIL PLANE section base number is
for ZONE NUMBER, the EVEN numbers identify the ones on
Answers: the RH side of the A/C
the LH side of the A/C
the upper fuselage of the A/C

Questions.QuestionString: Which jacking point use to lift the aircraft?
Answers: Nose l/g jacking point and main landing gears jacking point and safety stay
Nose l/g jacking point and main landing gears jacking point

Questions.QuestionString: Towing can be carried out using:
Answers: Towbar or towbarless tractor at NLG
Towbar or towbarless tractor at MLG

Questions.QuestionString: A 320/321 are the aircrafts with:
For the horizontal stabilizer the reference station 0 is at the horizontal Y axis and at:
If an ENGINE is running
Answers: You can tow the aircraft from the front only.
You can push the aircraft only.
Either tow or push is possible.

Questions.QuestionString: The maximum SAFETY PRESSURE for refueling is:
The fuselage section base number is: (level 1)
There is no safe access to the engine through the entry corridor when: (level 1)
Answers: Engine is running up to minimum idle
Engine is running above minimum idle
Engine is running at any power setting

Questions.QuestionString: If the aircraft does not point into the wind and wind speed or gusts more than 50 Kts, moor the aircraft at: (level 1)
